# Course/Textbooks

-   Python for Geospatial Data Analysis textbook -- check Monash Library
-   [Intermediate Earth Data Science Textbook](https://www.earthdatascience.org/courses/use-data-open-source-python/)
-   [Spatial Data Science (with applications in R), *Edzer Pebesma, Roger Bivand*](https://keen-swartz-3146c4.netlify.app) (2022)
-   [*An Introduction to Spatial Data Analysis and Statistics: A Course in R*](https://paezha.github.io/spatial-analysis-r/front-matter.html#front-matter)*, Antonio Paez (2021)*
-   [{terra} Tutorials and docs](https://rspatial.org/terra/index.html)
-   [Spatio-Temporal Statistics with R](https://spacetimewithr.org/)
-   [Applied Spatial Data Analysis with R](http://gis.humboldt.edu/OLM/r/Spatial%20Analysis%20With%20R.pdf)
-   [Geocomputation with R](https://geocompr.robinlovelace.net/index.html)
    -   [{mlr3} book subsection on spatio-temporal analysis](https://mlr3book.mlr-org.com/special-tasks.html#spatiotemporal)
-   [ ] [{mlr3} vs {tidymodels}](https://pharmacoecon.me/post/2021-05-01-tidymodels-vs-mlr3/)
-   Intro to GIS and Spatial Analysis, Manuel Gidmond
    -   [Pitfalls to avoid](https://mgimond.github.io/Spatial/pitfalls-to-avoid.html)

        -   patterns in non-uniform areal units

# Relevant Software

See also <!--# TODO: link to infrastructure  -->

-   R: `{rgee}` for accessing Google Earth Engine in R -- [cheatsheet](https://github.com/r-earthengine/cheatsheet)
-   Python: `rasterio` for [pythonic API](https://rasterio.readthedocs.io/en/latest/quickstart.html) for raster manipulation in python (probably not needed)
-   R:`{blockCV}` for generating spatially disjoint sets -- [paper](https://besjournals.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1111/2041-210X.13107), [github repo](https://github.com/rvalavi/blockCV) - [CRAN Task View: Analysis of Spatial Data](https://cran.r-project.org/web/views/Spatial.html)
-   cli: {dvc} data version control
    -   [R code and reproducible model development with DVC](https://dvc.org/blog/r-code-and-reproducible-model-development-with-dvc)

## Quarto + Rstudio Visual Mode

### Blog Posts on Quarto

-   https://www.apreshill.com/blog/2022-04-we-dont-talk-about-quarto/
-   https://www.njtierney.com/post/2022/04/11/rmd-to-qmd/

### 2022 Reproducible Authoring with Quarto - Mine √áetinkaya-Rundel

Talk given at 2022 Toronto Workshop for Reproducibility

üì∫ [Link to YouTube Recording](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6p4vOKS6Xls)

-   [01:18](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6p4vOKS6Xls&t=78s) RMarkdown -\> Quarto + live demo
-   [04:16](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6p4vOKS6Xls&t=256s) RStudio Visual Editor -- removes some cognitive load of learning RMarkdown + coding, forward slash "/" to - insert anything
-   [05:35](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6p4vOKS6Xls&t=335s) Quarto can render RMarkdown even if you just change the file extension
-   [06:10](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6p4vOKS6Xls&t=370s) Shared features -- output: --\> format:, live rendering, citations (from DOI search!), in-line R code
-   [12:20](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6p4vOKS6Xls&t=740s) Quarto specific -- YAML style chunk options (great for alt text) but mixed style works!; global chunk - options in yaml header; code-link: true
-   [16:18](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6p4vOKS6Xls&t=978s) Visual Editor helps with avoiding minutiae of markdown syntax -- alt-text, captions, links, tab-sets
-   [18:13](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6p4vOKS6Xls&t=1093s) Change output from html to reveal.js slides -- \`chalkboard: true\` adds annotation tool; built-in - presentation tools
-   [20:14](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6p4vOKS6Xls&t=1214s) more Quarto features-- R and python, support in other text editors, projects
-   [24:15](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6p4vOKS6Xls&t=1455s) Q&A
